newsitem.title: THAILAND: Mandela arrives in Thailand for two-day visit.
newsitem.headline: Mandela arrives in Thailand for two-day visit.

text.p: South African President Nelson Mandela arrived in Bangkok on Wednesday for a two-day visit to strengthen relations and improve trade with Thailand.

Mandela, whose comes to Thailand at the end of a three-nation tour, was due to hold bilateral talks with Thai premier Chavalit Yongchaiyudh on Wednesday and have an audience with King Bhumibol Adulyadej later in the day.
A Thai government spokesman told Reuters that Chavalit hoped to discuss ways to improve trade and boost tourism between the two countries during Mandela's visit.
"I expect the major issues to be discussed will cover mainly tourism and investment," Varathep Ratanakorn said. "South Africa has an abundance of raw materials which Thailand would like to exploit."
Last year two-way trade amounted to about 10.4 billion baht ($347 million) and Thailand had a slight trade deficit with South Africa, Varathep said.
Mandela, who will receive an honorary doctorate from Chulalongkorn University on Thursday, arrived in Thailand after state visits to Indonesia and Britain.
